item.title: Ryland add a quote by Frank Zappa
item.description: "So many books, so little time." -- Frank Zappa

item.title: Ryland add a quote by Logan Pearsall Smith
item.description: "People say that life is the thing, but I prefer reading." -- Logan Pearsall Smith

item.title: Ryland add a quote by Woody Allen
item.description: "My one regret in life is that I am not someone else." -- Woody Allen

item.title: Ryland add a quote by Anthony G. Oettinger
item.description: "Time flies like an arrow; fruit flies like a banana." -- Anthony G. Oettinger

item.title: Ryland add a quote by Friedrich Nietzsche
item.description: "It is hard enough to remember my opinions, without also remembering my reasons for them!" -- Friedrich Nietzsche

item.title: Ryland add a quote by Groucho Marx
item.description: "Outside of a dog, a book is man's best friend. Inside of a dog it's too dark to read." -- Groucho Marx

item.title: Ryland add a quote by Groucho Marx
item.description: "Those are my principles, and if you don't like them...well I have others." -- Groucho Marx

item.title: Ryland add a quote by Groucho Marx
item.description: "Why, look at me. I've worked my way up from nothing to a state of extreme poverty." -- Groucho Marx

item.title: Ryland add a quote by Groucho Marx
item.description: "Marriage is a wonderful institution...but who wants to live in an institution?" -- Groucho Marx

item.title: Ryland add a quote by Groucho Marx
item.description: "Do you mind if I don't smoke?" -- Groucho Marx

item.title: Ryland add a quote by Friedrich Nietzsche
item.description: "That which does not kill us makes us stronger." -- Friedrich Nietzsche

item.title: Ryland add a quote by Friedrich Nietzsche
item.description: "It is not a lack of love, but a lack of friendship that makes unhappy marriages." -- Friedrich Nietzsche

item.title: Ryland add a quote by Friedrich Nietzsche
item.description: "Whoever fights monsters should see to it that in the process he does not become a monster. And if you gaze long enough into an abyss, the abyss will gaze back into you." -- Friedrich Nietzsche

item.title: Ryland add a quote by Friedrich Nietzsche
item.description: "There is always some madness in love. But there is also always some reason in madness." -- Friedrich Nietzsche

item.title: Ryland add a quote by Friedrich Nietzsche
item.description: "Ah, women. They make the highs higher and the lows more frequent." -- Friedrich Nietzsche

item.title: Ryland add a quote by Rodney Dangerfield
item.description: "My wife and I were happy for twenty years. Then we met." -- Rodney Dangerfield

item.title: Ryland add a quote by Raymond Chandler
item.description: "Without magic, there is no art. Without art, there is no idealism. Without idealism, there is no integrity. Without integrity, there is nothing but production." -- Raymond Chandler

item.title: Ryland add a quote by Raymond Chandler
item.description: "I don't mind your showing me your legs. They're very swell legs and it's a pleasure to make their acquaintace. I don't mind if you don't like my manners. They're pretty bad. I grieve over them during the long winter nights." -- Raymond Chandler

item.title: Ryland add a quote by Raymond Chandler
item.description: "A good story cannot be devised; it has to be distilled." -- Raymond Chandler

item.title: Ryland add a quote by Bill Watterson
item.description: "You know, Hobbes, some days even my lucky rocket ship underpants don't help." -- Bill Watterson

item.title: Ryland add a quote by Groucho Marx
item.description: "When you're in jail, a good friend will be trying to bail you out. A best friend will be in the cell next to you saying, 'Damn, that was fun'." -- Groucho Marx

item.title: Ryland add a quote by Groucho Marx
item.description: "Groucho: You know I think you're the most beautiful woman in the world? Woman: Really? Groucho: No, but I don't mind lying if it gets me somewhere." -- Groucho Marx

item.title: Ryland add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "I haven't any right to criticize books, and I don't do it except when I hate them. I often want to criticize Jane Austen, but her books madden me so that I can't conceal my frenzy from the reader; and therefore I have to stop every time I begin. Every time I read Pride and Prejudice I want to dig her up and beat her over the skull with her own shin-bone." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Ryland add a quote by Frank Zappa
item.description: "Without deviation from the norm, progress is not possible." -- Frank Zappa

item.title: Ryland add a quote by Richard Dawkins
item.description: "We are all atheists about most of the gods that humanity has ever believed in. Some of us just go one god further." -- Richard Dawkins

item.title: Ryland add a quote by Mel Brooks
item.description: "I've been accused of vulgarity. I say that's bullshit." -- Mel Brooks

item.title: Ryland add a quote by Mel Brooks
item.description: "Tragedy is when I cut my finger. Comedy is when you fall into an open sewer and die." -- Mel Brooks

item.title: Ryland add a quote by Mel Brooks
item.description: "As long as the world is turning and spinning, we're gonna be dizzy and we're gonna make mistakes." -- Mel Brooks

item.title: Ryland add a quote by Ernest Hemingway
item.description: "There is nothing to writing. All you do is sit down at a typewriter and bleed." -- Ernest Hemingway

item.title: Ryland add a quote by Peter De Vries
item.description: "I love being a writer. What I can't stand is the paperwork." -- Peter De Vries
